Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[mono-sdks] <DownloadUri/> should not run during design-time builds" (#2439) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2350

Most of the logic in `mono-runtimes.csproj` was happening during
`CoreCompile`. The problem with this is that design-time builds in
Visual Studio runs `CoreCompile`. The `Task.Wait` in `<DownloadUri/>`
causes a hang.

The easy fix is to just run these targets in `mono-runtimes` during
`Build` instead of `CoreCompile`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xa-prep-tasks] use JdkInfo to find JavaSdkDirectory" (#2436) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
On Windows, if you have Microsoft OpenJDK installed, you currently
needed a `Configuration.Override.props` such as:

    <Project>
      <PropertyGroup>
        <JavaSdkDirectory>C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.8.0_161</JavaSdkDirectory>
      </PropertyGroup>
    </Project>

The Xamarin.Android build can't currently work with Microsoft OpenJDK,
because it is missing header files.

I've updated the `JdkInfo` MSBuild task to match a similar task in
Java.Interop. It now validates that JDKs are < 8.0, and contain valid
header files.

Now I am able to build Xamarin.Android on a Windows machine with
multiple JDKs and it picks the correct one.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Use a field for GC references" (#2435) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened issue "Add support for dedup" (#2434) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Mono added support for deduplication of AOT'ed code a while back. It leads to a noticeable reduction in binary size. It's currently being used with WebAssembly and it's being integrated into xamarin-macios

It requires minor changes to the build integration to work.

It works by making two passes
1) In the first pass, all code that can't be duplicated is emitted.
2) In the second pass, all of the potentially duplicated code, for all of the input assemblies, is placed in a single aot module that acts as a "container" or "dummy" assembly for them. 

The iOS integration of it is here: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/pull/3783 . This should provide a concrete example of how to add this support. 

1) Create another assembly during the build that's empty (we'll call it DummyName.dll)
2) Create phase 1 above by aoting with `--aot=dedup-skip`
3) Create phase 2 by aoting with a single mono invocation and all assemblies passed (including the dummy), and `--aot=dedup-include=DummyName.dll`
4) Make sure DummyName.dll is bundled/registered/loaded before main is run.

The rest should be handled by the loading machinery. We mark the DummyName.dll.so as a special aot module and do all of the fixes to code finding once it's loaded.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Update AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion " (#2433) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
For sanity/consistency, [`$(AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion)`](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/c38c58e9c5634819845350e9e687186c0808a781/src/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets), `$(AndroidSdkPlatformToolsVersion)`, and `$(AndroidSdkToolsVersion)` should be updated to be consistent with the latest supported `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)`.  As we now support v9.0 (API-28), these properties should be updated to use the 28 versions of these packages, e.g. build-tools 28.0.3:

https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/build-tools

Addtionally, we should update the [`HowToAddNewApiLevel.md`](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/master/Documentation/workflow/HowToAddNewApiLevel.md) docs should be updated to mention that these properties should be updated when a new API level is added.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Build error when MainActivity's base class' name is a Java reserved word" (#2432) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
C# code that uses a Java reserved word as an identifier for the main activity or the base class thereof will cause a Java compiler error.

While the steps below demonstrate how to most easily see the errors, the issue was brought to my attention by a [StackOverflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53291247/vague-dotfuscator-error-on-xamarin-android-app) regarding [the Xamarin integration](https://blog.xamarin.com/protecting-xamarin-apps-dotfuscator/) of a protection tool I develop, Dotfuscator. (**Note**: I am filing this issue on behalf of my employer, PreEmptive Solutions, a Xamarin partner.)

In this case, Dotfuscator's renaming obfuscation changes the (simple) name of the base class of an activity to `do`. Because Dotfuscator operates on compiled .NET assemblies, this is normally not an issue for non-library projects (`do` is a reserved word in C#, but not in the .NET intermediate language), but Xamarin.Android appears to be creating Java types to match this renamed .NET type, and `do` being a reserved word in Java is causing the build errors.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Android project (the attached reproduction uses the `Visual C# -> Android -> Android App (Xamarin) template`).
2. Add a new class, `do` (escaped as `@do` in C#), which has the base class `Android.Support.V7.App.AppCompatActivity`.
3. Change the base class of `MainActivity` to `@do`.
4. Build.

[XamarinAndroidKeywords.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2582998/XamarinAndroidKeywords.zip)

### Expected Behavior

The build succeeds.

### Actual Behavior

The build errors with Java compiler errors, such as the following in the `obj\Debug\MonoAndroid81\android\src\md5c30be36ca273ec2d8db66341a5aebd89\MainActivity.java` file:

```
error: <identifier> expected
	extends md5c30be36ca273ec2d8db66341a5aebd89.do
error: illegal start of type
	implements	XamarinAndroidKeywords
error: ';' expected
		mono.android.IGCUserPeer
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "UWP's TitleView of the MasterDetailPage's Detail not shown" (#3940) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
I Use a navigationpage.titleview in the Xamarin.form app now,
MasterDetailPage is myapp's root page.
And the Detail property of the MasterDetailPage is a navigationpage object:

```xaml
<MasterDetailPage.Detail>
        <NavigationPage Style="{DynamicResource navigationPageStyle}">
            <x:Arguments>
                <local:IndexView></local:IndexView>
            </x:Arguments>
        </NavigationPage>
    </MasterDetailPage.Detail>
```

IndexView is a TabbedPage object. And codes at IndexView.xaml use these titleview:

```xaml
<NavigationPage.TitleView>
        <Grid BackgroundColor="White">
            <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
                <ColumnDefinition Width="*"></ColumnDefinition>
                <ColumnDefinition Width="auto"></ColumnDefinition>
            </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <Entry VerticalOptions="Center" Placeholder="Search">
                <Grid.Column>0</Grid.Column>
            </Entry>
            <Button VerticalOptions="Center" Text="Go">
                <Grid.Column>1</Grid.Column>
            </Button>
        </Grid>
    </NavigationPage.TitleView>
```


Android is fine.
IOS not check .
UWP not show.

But，after I use an NavigationPage as parent which wrap the MasterDetailPage,
The titleview show !
But that will found another issue that , the NavigationPage which wrap the MasterDetailPage, its' BarBackgroundColor or BackgroundColor can not be changed .
That I can't  go on my customer theme work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[UWP] TitleView does not appear" (#4461) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Not sure if it's related to #3834 , but I'm not seeing the TitleView I expect on UWP.

### Steps to Reproduce

https://github.com/davidortinau/TheLittleThingsPlayground/blob/master/TheLittleThingsPlayground/Views/ThreeTwoPage.xaml#L17

```
<NavigationPage.TitleView>
        <StackLayout Orientation="Horizontal" VerticalOptions="Center" Spacing="10">
            <Image Source="{OnPlatform UWP=Assets/iconXamagon.png, Default=iconXamagon.png}">
                <Image.GestureRecognizers>
                    <TapGestureRecognizer
                        Command="{Binding TapCommand, Mode=OneWay}"
                        CommandParameter="https://www.xamarin.com"/>
                </Image.GestureRecognizers>
            </Image>
            <Label Text="3.2.0" FontSize="16" TextColor="Black" VerticalTextAlignment="Center" />
        </StackLayout>
    </NavigationPage.TitleView>
```

### Expected Behavior

TitleView content appears in the blue bar title space.

### Actual Behavior

It's empty.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.4.0.1008975

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/48685744-7ae3f800-eb7d-11e8-9bf2-431c03c8c8a2.png)

Android version showing the xamagon and 3.2.0 label I expect to see somewhere on UWP.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/48685760-951dd600-eb7d-11e8-963d-c78a0d5496af.png)


### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/davidortinau/TheLittleThingsPlayground/blob/master/TheLittleThingsPlayground/Views/ThreeTwoPage.xaml#L17

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[UWP] Switch color is not set" (#4460) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

3.1.0 introduced the ability to set the color of a switch. This isn't working for UWP.

### Steps to Reproduce
```
<Switch OnColor="Purple" IsToggled="true" />
```

### Expected Behavior

Switch color is purple.

### Actual Behavior

Switch color is blue.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.4.0.1008975

### Screenshots

Android showing the purple:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/48685561-939fde00-eb7c-11e8-956c-e46fe7308886.png)

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/davidortinau/TheLittleThingsPlayground/blob/master/TheLittleThingsPlayground/Views/ThreeOnePage.xaml#L56

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[UWP] BoxView CornerRadius doesn't work" (#4459) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
When setting the corner radius, UWP doesn't render it.

### Steps to Reproduce
Run this:

https://github.com/davidortinau/TheLittleThingsPlayground/blob/master/TheLittleThingsPlayground/Views/ThreeTwoPage.xaml#L86

```
<BoxView FlexLayout.AlignSelf="Center"
                     BackgroundColor="#CC3300"
                     WidthRequest="200"
                     HeightRequest="100"
                     CornerRadius="10,0,0,10"
                     />
```

### Expected Behavior

Top left and lower right corners should be rounded.

### Actual Behavior

They are not rounded.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.4.0.1008975

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/48685417-c1d0ee00-eb7b-11e8-8b34-5f94376b7bf7.png)

Android showing what is expected:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/48685419-cac1bf80-eb7b-11e8-84e3-1a5d5cf31e16.png)


### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/davidortinau/TheLittleThingsPlayground/blob/master/TheLittleThingsPlayground/Views/ThreeTwoPage.xaml#L86

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[UWP] Label MaxLines doesn't work" (#4458) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Label MaxLines should display 4 lines and then truncation, but it only shows one line. IF I remove the `LineBreakMode="TailTruncation"` then I get 4 lines.

### Steps to Reproduce
Run this and use the 3.3 page.

https://github.com/davidortinau/TheLittleThingsPlayground/blob/master/TheLittleThingsPlayground/Views/ThreeThreePage.xaml#L37

```
<Label x:Name="TruncatedLabel" MaxLines="4" LineBreakMode="TailTruncation" Text="You should see 4 lines of text and truncation at the end. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam mattis quam non enim pellentesque, ut placerat purus finibus. Nulla quis tincidunt ante. Ut mauris lectus, aliquam a sagittis vitae, consequat eget elit. Interdum et malesuada fames ac ante ipsum primis in faucibus. Pellentesque convallis nunc nisi, a imperdiet elit efficitur et. Duis in lectus mollis, interdum ipsum et, tincidunt orci. Fusce ipsum metus, imperdiet non lacus vitae, facilisis feugiat magna. Nulla volutpat nisl tortor, a consectetur felis consectetur non. Curabitur in enim vulputate sem volutpat bibendum id nec lorem. Mauris laoreet lacus ac volutpat tempus."/>
```

### Expected Behavior
I should see 4 lines ending with truncation "...".

### Actual Behavior
I see 1 line ending with truncation "...".

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.4.0.1008975

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/48685016-f04dc980-eb79-11e8-8428-00fbae806887.png)

After removing `LineBreakMode="TailTruncation"`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/48685106-46bb0800-eb7a-11e8-844e-2281108d8cc8.png)


### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/davidortinau/TheLittleThingsPlayground/blob/master/TheLittleThingsPlayground/Views/ThreeThreePage.xaml#L37

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[iOS] center title icon on ios if there is no titleview" (#4457) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

If there is no title view present then center the title icon. This is how it used to work before the titleview changes were made for creating a full width titleview

### Issues Resolved ### 
<!-- Please use the format "fixes #xxxx" for each issue this PR addresses -->

- fixes #4138 

### Platforms Affected ### 
- iOS

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
refer to #4138 to see how it should look.

### Testing Procedure ###
- Go to the titleview gallery
- toggle the titleview until there isn't one
- toggle the title icon
- ensure that it is centered

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [X] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [X] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xaml] Add provided value to collection" (#4456) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

There is a line with the following content prior to the changed one:
```C#
ProvideValue(ref value, node, source, XmlName.Empty);
```

`ProvideValue` executes `IMarkupExtension` and `IValueProvider`. However, the modified `value` was ignored and `Values[node]` was used instead. This change fixes the problem.
<!-- Describe your changes here. -->

### Issues Resolved ### 
<!-- Please use the format "fixes #xxxx" for each issue this PR addresses -->

None

### API Changes ###
<!-- List all API changes here (or just put None), example:

Added:
 - string ListView.GroupName { get; set; } //Bindable Property
 - int ListView.GroupId { get; set; } // Bindable Property
 - void ListView.Clear ();

Changed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 Removed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 -->
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Core/XAML (all platforms)
- iOS
- Android
- UWP

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

Not applicable

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dynamic style does not update layout after padding change." (#3824) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Padding property is changed in dynamic style but layout isn't invalidated. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create basic ContentPage:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<ContentPage xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms"
             xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
             xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Xamarin32DynamicResourceProblem"
             x:Class="Xamarin32DynamicResourceProblem.MainPage"
             Padding="50">

    <ContentPage.Resources>
        <ResourceDictionary>

            <Style x:Key="longStyle" TargetType="ContentView">
                <Setter Property="Padding" Value="100,0,0,0"/>
                <Setter Property="BackgroundColor" Value="Red"/>
            </Style>

            <Style x:Key="shortStyle" TargetType="ContentView">
                <Setter Property="Padding" Value="50,0,0,0"/>
                <Setter Property="BackgroundColor" Value="Green"/>
            </Style>

        </ResourceDictionary>
    </ContentPage.Resources>

    <StackLayout>

        <ContentView Style="{DynamicResource paddingStyle}">
            <Label Text="TEST"/>
        </ContentView>

        <Button Text="shortStyle" Clicked="ApplyShortStyle"/>
        <Button Text="longStyle" Clicked="ApplyLongStyle"/>
        
    </StackLayout>

</ContentPage>


2. In code behind apply dynamic style:


        private void ApplyLongStyle(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {
            Resources["paddingStyle"] = Resources["longStyle"];

        }

        private void ApplyShortStyle(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {
            Resources["paddingStyle"] = Resources["shortStyle"];
        }

3. Tap one from buttons to apply new style.

### Expected Behavior

Color and padding is changed.

### Actual Behavior

Only color is changed. Padding change is not visible until layout is invalidated (for example after device rotation).

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.2.0.839982
- Last known good version: 3.1.0.697729
- IDE: Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 Version 15.8.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  8.0
  - Android: 8.1

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ScrollView IsClippedToBounds="true" not rendering on Android with Forms 3.3 & 3.4" (#4455) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
My existing project has forms that basically look like this:

<StackLayout Orientation="Vertical" VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand">
     <StackLayout  ...>
          <ScrollView ... IsClippedToBounds="true">
               <StackLayout ...>
                    Bunch of controls
               </StackLayout>
          </ScrollView>
     </StackLayout>
     <StackLayout  Orientation="Vertical" VerticalOptions="EndAndExpand">
          Some buttons
     </StackLayout>
</StackLLayout>

In Forms 3.2 everything works great but starting with Forms 3.3 the first scroll page renders but subsequent pages do not.

When setting IsClippedToBound off, the pages render but overlay the buttons.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[d16-0-p2] [msbuild] Fixed compilation of SceneKit assets in library projects" (#5138) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
The problem is that AppBundleDir never gets defined for library projects.

Luckily, _AppBundleName and AppBundleExtension are always defined and
all we need is the directory name (i.e. MyApp.app), so this will work
just fine.

Fixes issue #5129

Backport of #5130.

/cc @spouliot @jstedfast

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[QuickLook] Add [ThreadSafe] to `QLThumbnailReply`" (#5119) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
`QLThumbnailReply` and `QLFileThumbnailRequest`  members are called
from a background thread within `QLThumbnailProvider` extension
so our check on `UIApplication.EnsureUIThread ()` is not needed.

Fixes xamarin/xamarin-macios#5117

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "QLThumbnailReply.CreateReply incorrectly calls EnsureUIThread" (#5117) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
```
public unsafe static QLThumbnailReply CreateReply (CGSize contextSize, Func<CGContext, bool> drawingBlock)
```
Calls `UIApplication.EnsureUIThread ()` but it should not.

This method gets called by `QLThumbnailProvider.ProvideThumbnail` which runs on a background thread.

If you look at Xcode's template for document apps, you'll see that they don't do any UI thread synchronization.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an iOS thumbnail extension
2. Note the crash when you call `CreateReply`

### Expected Behavior

Can call the method on the background thread.

### Actual Behavior

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MT3001 when attempting to build iOS Device project that uses Net Core SignalR with Linking off" (#5137) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce
Just create a blank forms app and add Microsoft,AspNetCore.SignalR.Client, turn off linking and build release or debug for device (not simulator)
1. Create a blank Forms App
2. Add Microsoft,AspNetCore.SignalR.Client (1.0.4)
3. Turn off linking
4. Add the following block of code if Main.xaml.cs just to reference package
        HubConnection hubConnection;
        public MainPage()
        {
            InitializeComponent();

            hubConnection = new HubConnectionBuilder()
                .WithUrl($"https://mccommunicator.azurewebsites.net/chat")
                .Build();
        }
5. Build

### Expected Behavior
Clean build

### Actual Behavior
MT3001 build error
MTOUCH: Error MT3001: Could not AOT the assembly 'Test.iOS/obj/iPhone/Debug/device-builds/iphone10.6-12.1.1/mtouch-cache/3-Build/System.Threading.Channels.dll' (MT3001) (Test.iOS)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "MT3001 when attempting to build iOS Device project that uses Net Core SignalR" (#5137) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce
Just create a blank forms app and add Microsoft,AspNetCore.SignalR.Client, turn off linking and build release or debug for device (not simulator)
1. Create a blank Forms App
2. Add Microsoft,AspNetCore.SignalR.Client (1.0.4)
3. Turn off linking
4. Add the following block of code if Main.xaml.cs just to reference package
        HubConnection hubConnection;
        public MainPage()
        {
            InitializeComponent();

            hubConnection = new HubConnectionBuilder()
                .WithUrl($"https://mccommunicator.azurewebsites.net/chat")
                .Build();
        }
5. Build

### Expected Behavior
Clean build

### Actual Behavior
MT3001 build error
MTOUCH: Error MT3001: Could not AOT the assembly 'Test.iOS/obj/iPhone/Debug/device-builds/iphone10.6-12.1.1/mtouch-cache/3-Build/System.Threading.Channels.dll' (MT3001) (Test.iOS)

### Environment
Have tested on Stable and Alpha also.
